question: 帰郷する
sourceMnemonic: If you <kanji>return</kanji> to the <kanji>hometown</kanji> you are going <vocabulary>to return to one's hometown</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>帰</ja> is the on'yomi reading, which you haven't learned. Just think about how when you return to your hometown, you're going to need a <reading>key</reading> (<ja>き</ja>) to get into your old home, which you haven't been to in a long time.
